### Ingest and wrangle data



```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

src <- read.csv('archetypes/hdi-2020.csv', encoding = "UTF-8")
# src

# The pca function can only take numeric values,
# so we convert Country column to be rownames
src <- column_to_rownames(src, var = "Country")
# src

# Convert string to numeric
src$Gross.national.income..GNI..per.capita <- parse_number(src$Gross.national.income..GNI..per.capita)
src

# Remove HDI ranks to use key indicators only
df <- src %>% select(Life.expectancy.at.birth, Expected.years.of.schooling, Mean.years.of.schooling, Gross.national.income..GNI..per.capita, )
df

```

### Fit a principal components model

```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# fit a principal components model
df_pca <- prcomp(x = df, 
              center = TRUE, 
              scale = TRUE)
df_pca

```

### Plot

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source='fold-hide', fig.width=1920/72, fig.height=1080/72, out.width="100%"}

# fviz_pca function produces a ggplot2 graph.
v1 <- fviz_pca(df_pca,  repel = TRUE,  labelsize = 3) + 
  theme_bw() +
  labs(title = "HDI Biplot")

# Draw plot
girafe(ggobj = v1, width_svg = 13, height_svg = 7,
       options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0)))


```
 
 
 
```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, class.source='fold-show'}

# eval = FALSE as default; run manually as chunk

# full version
ggsave(v1, filename = "outputs/human-development-index.svg", plot = v1, width=1920/72, height=720/72)

#

```
